Prerequisites: PREREQUISITE(S): ACG 3103 WITH A MINIMUM GRADE OF B
Course Description: AN EXTENSION OF ACG 3103 INCLUDING THE ADVANCED STUDY OF LONG-TERM ASSETS, CURRENT AND LONG-TERM LIABILITIES, AND EQUITIES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
THE SUCCESSFUL STUDENT WILL: 
1. COMMUNICATE EFFECTIVELY USING THE LANGUAGE OF ACCOUNTING.
2. HAVE A CLEAR UNDERSTANDING OF FINANCIAL STATEMENT MEASUREMENT AND DISCLOSURE STANDARDS FOR THE TOPICS DISCUSSED.
3.DEVELOPE ANALYTICAL ABILITY AND CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS AS THEY RELATE TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, FINANCIAL MEASUREMENT AND FINANCIAL REPORTING STANDARDS.
4. BE ABLE TO COMMUNICATE, ANALYZE AND SOLVE FINANCIAL 
REPORTING PROBLEMS, AND INTRGRATE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING KNOWLEDGE TO ADD MANAGERS IN DECISION MAKING.
Textbook(s):
INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING, 16TH EDITION
KIESO&WEYGANDT
JOHN WILEY & SONS
NY, NY 2007
